intro: Borrichia demissa, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dunes and maritime environments. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Borrichia demissa is adapted to salt spray and strong winds, making it a resilient species in harsh coastal habitats.
